word: Achan, the guilty party, did not feel the burden. He took it very coolly. We find nothing in the account to signify that he felt distressed. There is no evidence that he felt remorse, or reasoned from cause to effect, saying. \93It is my sin that has brought the displeasure of the Lord upon the people.\94 . . . He had no idea of making his wrong right by confession of sin and humiliation of soul.\97The Seventh-day Adventist Bible Commentary, Ellen G. White Comments, vol. 2, p. 997.
